summary: In 1975, a woman named Lynette "Squeaky" Fromme tried to shoot President Gerald Ford in California. She was very close to him but didn't load the gun properly, so it didn't fire. Ford kept walking and met with the governor. Fromme went to prison for a long time, 34 years, and was released after Ford had already died. The gun she used is now in a museum.
title: Attempted assassination of Gerald Ford in Sacramento
